column4: switching to xfce won't make the power management issue go away, its a regression in the kernel (fixed in 3.2.5 though)
Oh! I see. What should I do then? :-|
wait for precise to be released in april
running a different kernel means we can't support you here if anything goes wrong
terminhell Damn. Am so confused. :-( What to do then?
wait for 12.04 or try the ppa (knowing the risks)
Some alpha version (not sure about the term) is available on net I believe? Shall I try it ?
of 12.04 i mean
up to you. its not stable so there are risks
Risk as in?
stuff may break, do you know what alpha means?
I believe, they keep making changes, fixing bugs, till it comes very stable for public consumption
alpha usually involves implementing features, beta is usually bug-fixing and then you get the rc and actual release (by then it is safe to use)
Oh. Thanks for info.
Why the issue is there though? It is all about kernel?
yes, it is a regression in the kernel
How can I check if am running on latest version of kernel or not
uname -a
terminhell 3.0.0-15-generic-pae #26-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jan 20 17:07:31 UTC 2012 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux
there is an update, but you won't get 3.2.5 or higher on 11.10 unless you deliberately install it
And how can i install it?
sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get upgrade (that will get you the latest in the repo which is 3.0.0.16)
no worries :)
